meanings.definition: The shaft of a long bone.
meanings.sent1: The diaphysis provides support and structure to the bone.
meanings.sent2: Doctors examined the diaphysis of the femur for any signs of fracture.
meanings.sent3: The diaphysis of the bone was feeling a bit lonely without its bone marrow.
meanings.sent4: The diaphysis stood tall and strong, like a pillar supporting the bone.
meanings.sent5: The diaphysis, like a sturdy pole, held the bone together.

meanings.definition: The middle part of a long bone.
meanings.sent1: In the anatomy class, students learned about the diaphysis as the central region of the bone.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon focused on repairing the diaphysis of the broken radius.
meanings.sent3: The diaphysis was the heart of the bone, keeping everything connected.
meanings.sent4: The diaphysis, like a bridge, connected the two ends of the bone.
meanings.sent5: The diaphysis was like the core of the bone, essential for its strength.
